alert.note: Alert for East Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet; Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued March 04 at 2:52AM MST until March 05 at 2:00AM MST by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 2 AM MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Southwest winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. East slope locations will see occasionally stronger winds. * WHERE...For the Sacramento Mountains above 7500 feet and the east slopes. * WHEN...From 11 AM this morning to 2 AM MST Saturday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strong winds will make driving hazardous, especially along north/south running roads and highways. The strong winds will also create areas of blowing dust which will cause quickly changing visibilities for motorists.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet; Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet
